>

>>>(I use the TextXsomesuffix pattern as well... e.g. TestXDB for 
>>>database dependent tests)
>>
>>Allow me, M. Beust !
>>
>>"That's just another great reason for test groups...."

I already do something like this manually. My tests are called either 
'*Test' or '*RemoteTest'. The former are run as prerequisites for a 
successful deliverable (such as an .ear file), while the latter are run 
after the deployment of the .ear. It's a bit of work to set this up in 
Ant (with lots of <includes> and <excludes>), but now that it's in 
place, it works quite well.

I assume from J.B. and Cedric's comments that test groups are part of 
TestNG, which I haven't had time to research. It's been enough of a 
headache getting our group to use what little infrastructure I've 
already put into place.
